content.label: Deep strategy and worth gameplay..!
The various tactics and abilities make this different and better than many other similar games.
Fun

I can see why people paid $9.99 for this game. Immersive, great game mechanics make it a game that's hard to put down. It doesn't feel like a game that's a couple years old. The developers took care to keep it modern and adapt new iOS technologies as they came. 

That's a company that cares. Highly recommend this to others.
This game should be the game of the century! Well done makers!!! I love the strategies and the story of this game. This game is worth more than three dollars great job guys!!!

Easily the best TBS in the app store, tied with XCom.

The next closest one is Great Little War Game followed by the Sega game whose name I forget (1990's game).
FF Tactics, considering the poor port implementation by Squeenix, is down the list.
Anyway, this game is simply excellent.
As a strategy board gamer, this is excellent!

This (along with RM: Mercenaries) is my favorite game on iOS. The gameplay is very well balanced, while the visual artwork, music, and story drew me in to the game's world. The turn-based nature of the game means I can play in short pieces where I might be interrupted, while the separate command and battle phases restore some of the fog of war that makes RTS so much fun.

My first strategy game was Chess, then battletech, then Dune 2, Warcraft, then Risk type games.
Battletech really stands out to me because of the individual unit level tactics you need to apply to the battle which can affect the whole strategy of the war.

Similar here, you don't just "sprout" units from a factory.  You fight with what you have.  Well scripted stuff.

Was introduced to this game by Ravenmark Mercenaries.  I like them both.
Easily one of the best strategy games for ios.

I downloaded this title when it first came out, and after beating it, put it down while the creators made more episodes. I'm just now rediscovering this ambitious game again. I love the depth of the story, their take on tactics in an iOS platform, and that they continue to create content.

This game has survived on my phone for two years now and has provided so many hours of satisfying tactical strategy fun. Honestly if there was a rating above 5 stars this game would get it. This game is a labor of love from some indie developers who are determined to make high quality games that do not try to nickel and dime you. Ravenmark presents a deep and satisfying tactical experience while also providing some fantastic world building and story telling. This is the best money I have spent on the App Store. Do yourself a favor and also check out the multiplayer Ravenmark: Mercenaries
This game should be ranked at number one for Stratgey

I liked this strategy game it is turn based, however, units move in order of the speed making it hard to move troops to attack, because sometime the enemy will move away from the space before you get a chance to move next to them to attack. It would be better if each individual unit had it's own turn. Rather than you attempting to move your whole team in between enemy movements.

I liked this strategy game it is turn based, however, units move in order of the speed making it hard to move troops to attack, because sometime the enemy will move away from the space before you get a chance to move next to them to attack. It would be better if each individual unit had it's own turn. Rather than you attempting to move your whole team in between enemy movements.

title.label: An okay attempt at a tactics game...

content.label:
This game looked really promising. I was told it was the closest thing to advance wars for iOS. I loved it at first but it gets to a point where the difficulty, even on easy, is still ridiculous. Reasons: You plan out your moves. The order in which all units act is determined by initiative. But surprise the AI is allowed to react accordingly during any of its unit's turn. So while the AI's units can all flank and out maneuver. Your units, except the highest initiative ones, will probably always be out of position. One could use the "advance" in any direction or "pursue" an enemy until it is dead options, but given the complex and constantly changing initiative orders you'll probably end up bottle-necking your units while the AI destroys them. More fun tidbits, if one of your units is pursuing but ends up next to a unit it isn't chasing it won't attack and instead stands ground for a turn. Or when one element of a formation is killed, all the other elements that were in the formation change their orders to stand ground. However the AI suffers no such thing and is able to counter immediately with units that had just lost their formation. One can choose a "rest" option where if a unit is not attacked it will heal for a small amount. The AI benefits from having units at rest still heal when attacked. So much of this game rides on luck and inconsistent mechanics that I cannot in good 
faith call this a legit tactics game. It shows a lot of promise but barring some changes it only gets 3 stars from me.
Really in to turn based strategy and this is up my alley. A little rock-paper-scissors based, but there's at least a fourth "element" to keep it interesting.
It's challenging for sure! Keep your eyes open and keep track of initiative. Not too many times have I needed to redo on the intro!
Even at easy level it's hard. See Xcom for a TBS game that's fun, not frustrating like Ravenmark ,

title.label: Best Strategy Game I have spent money on

content.label:
Gameplay is solid and the does a good job of easing you into the mechanics. It also remains difficult near the end of the game, with hard decisions to make (i.e. should I sacrifice this unit to keep the others alive or use a heroes power right now to save it) and they can still make more chapters as well, so there's lots of content. 

Graphics are good, art style looks amazing, as well as the characters' animations in cutscenes. 

Speaking of characters, the storyline is great. Character arcs are well thought out and realistic. You can really feel that a lot of time was put into fleshing out this world. If your willing to put a lot of into the game, the game will give you a lot of satisfaction back. 

Just don't do a binge session! It will drain you!
Challenging game, but really fun.
Not bad. Not bad at all.
Excellent turn-based strategy--there aren't many games of this quality out there.
Recommend this one if you like strategy

I've played many strategy games and this one is by FAR one of the best on iOS. The prelude/tutorial is engaging and the strategy is simple but challenging.

Highly recommended!

This is one of the best medieval fantasy turn-based strategy games on mobile devices. The combat mechanics offer lots of tactical choices, and the story is interesting. The developers really tried to flesh out the fantasy world where combat takes place, and I appreciate their efforts.

title.label: One game, two sets of rules

content.label: The AI isn't planning their moves ahead like you must- instead it moves it's units as they come up in initiative order.  Also, be prepared to watch your cavalry ride off into the sunset if their destination gets blocked early in their path, because they sure will use the full extent of their movement to try the long way.  These frustrations cost a star for my taste.
I wished for more RPG elements
Game would be fun but some points are WAY TOO hard.  Wish I would have read the online forums prior to purchasing.  The number one complaint and I agree is that it is ridiculously difficult.
This game is so fun like chest but 1,000,000 times better!!!!
This game has an excellent storyline and is probably one of the best damned strategy games of its time.  It rivals final fantasy tactics (the original)

One of the best turn based combat games for mobile platforms. A nice story, but where the game really shines is in a layered and satisfyingly diverse/complex battle system. Tons of unit variety, victory conditions, battle-scapes, and strategies to employ. A bit of a learning curve, especially daunting for players new to tactical games, but you should be in the swing of things after spending a couple hours in prelude battles. You can expect individual battles to take from 20 min to an hour. This is a game that will take some dedication and brain-burning, so if your looking for a quick fix, this ain't it. But if your looking for a game with some staying power that you can really sink your teeth into and get your money's-worth from. This is IT. Can't recommend this game highly enough!
Mechanics take getting used to but great game so far!

The game is great along with the makers of it! I needed help with something and they got it done the next day! Thanks guys! Also looking forward to future updates for Mercenaries and possibly even Scourge of Estellion.   ;)
Great introduction to the new Mercs game, definitely recommend both!

The strategy gameplay is excellent, kind of reminds me of warhammer fantasy. However the story and setting here is generic anime rpg influenced pap. I wish a game this good had better background, it would be awesome if these guys did a warhammer game, or at least something more interesting than this. Well the cardani elves are kind of cool though.
Title says it all.
Haven't seen a good TRPG since FFT. Haven't played through this completely yet, but so far so good. Great story and good battle mechanics. Loving it.

title.label: Really surprised to find a game of this caliber.

content.label: Story's a bit overwhelming in terms of plot, but the strategic depth and gameplay really rivals the classics of Advance Wars and Fire Emblem!

This game is a phenomenal blend of story and gameplay. The character attachment happens fairly quickly and you definitely get pulled into the story. It's a great forum for developing strategic thinking without getting bored too easily. I highly recommend it. The developers deserve praise for this one.
The story line is amazing and i cant wait for them to add to it
Well done rpg but I can't bring myself to understand why is the 2x speed option is going for sale???? Is that even make any sense?
Bull poo no good
Tons of depth and strategy - you won't be disappointed!!
Ravenmark is a Legend Lager in a world of Miller Lights.
Loving it so far!
Good game.  Can be pretty challenging at times.  I haven't played all the way through, but I've really enjoyed it so far.
Deepest, closest resemblance to Fire Emblem-esque play I've seen on the App Store. Brilliant game, excellent developer updates and support. A must-buy.

Just finished the amazing storyline, and am looking forward to what comes next.  What is the status on the multiplayer situation?  Multiplayer would be the only thing needed to make this game complete.

It's much more difficult than I'm used to but that's half the fun! No major complainants, unless you count the lack of a rotating screen. Still, great characters, great story, and amazing gameplay. It's a keeper.

Update: I just finished the game and...wow. Just wow. I'm sad the end has come but I look forward the the sequel.
